comments.body: @badaiaqrandista We should replace this if/else with a switch statement so that we are forced to handle every case. That makes it easier to avoid issues if we add new elements to the enum. Also, can we please add tests?

Btw, it seems that we are changing the behavior of `RESOLVE_CANONICAL_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS_ONLY` as well, right? Before, we would only use the first DNS IP for that option in the non bootstrap path. It would be good to make that clear in the KIP.
Yes, you are correct. If `client.dns.lookup=RESOLVE_CANONICAL_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS_ONLY` , then it will resolves the hostname to IP address using the default behaviour.
I've changed this into switch/case and updated the KIP.
Can we remove the default since we handled all the cases?
Can we add a test that passes `RESOLVE_CANONICAL_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS_ONLY` showing that we now get multiple addresses instead of only the first one. That's one of the changes in this PR.

@dajac I started making this change, but while working on it, I realized that I don't think I like requiring the `HostResolver` to understand the `client.dns.lookup` config. In the same way that `MockTime` is only used to mock Java built-in methods, I think the `HostResolver` should only be responsible for the DNS resolution (either real or mocked), and that `ClientUtils` should be responsible for understanding the Kafka application behavior. That way, tests that mock DNS still test the actual `ClientDnsLookup` behavior, rather than relying on both the default resolver and any mocked resolvers handle it correctly. It also means that if we ever add an option for `ClientDnsLookup` or change its behavior, we don't need to remember to update all `HostResolver` implementations.
Thanks @bob-barrett. I do agree with your point. Let's keep it as you suggested.
